chatbot_v2.ai.generate_proposal module

Module: generate_proposal.py

Module for filling fields into text using LLM (Large Language Model).

Classes:

  • AutoFillTemplate: A class for filling fields in a template.

Functions:

  • fill_template: Fill fields in a template synchronously.

  • fill_fields: Fill fields in a template asynchronously with streaming.

class chatbot_v2.ai.generate_proposal.AutoFillTemplate(model_name='str')[source]

Bases: object

AutoFillTemplate class for filling fields in a template.

Attributes:

model_name (str): The name of the language model to use. llm (ChatOpenAI): The ChatOpenAI instance for filling fields.

fill_fields(**kwargs)
fill_template(section_type, prompt: str, questions_answers: List[Dict], templates: List[Dict])[source]

Fill fields in a template synchronously.

Parameters:

section_type (str): The type of the proposal section to generate. prompt (str): The prompt or instruction for filling the template. questions_answers (List[Dict]): List of questions and answers. templates (List[Dict]): List of template options.

Returns:

str: The filled template.

chatbot_v2.ai.style_engine module

Module: style_engine.py

Module for language style correction and interpretation based on an editorial style guide manual.

Classes:

  • StyleGuideParser: Pydantic BaseModel for parsing style guide suggestions.

  • StyleGuideParserV2: Pydantic BaseModel for parsing style guide suggestions (alternate version).

  • StyleGuide: A class for generating and managing style guide information.

Functions:

  • styleguide_modify_input: Modify input text based on style guide suggestions.

class chatbot_v2.ai.style_engine.StyleGuide[source]

Bases: object

A class for generating and managing style guide information.

generate_chat_template() → str[source]

Generate a chat template based on style guide context.

Returns:

str: Generated chat template.

load_files() → None[source]

Load style guide files into memory.

read_style_guide_files(path: List[str]) → Dict[str, str][source]

Read and store contents of style guide files.

Parameters:

path (List[str]): List of file paths.

Returns:

Dict[str, str]: Dictionary containing file contents indexed by file path.

styleguide_modify_input(basemodel_class: ~pydantic.main.BaseModel = <class 'chatbot_v2.ai.style_engine.StyleGuideParserV2'>)[source]

Modify input text based on style guide suggestions.

Parameters:

basemodel_class (BaseModel, optional): Pydantic BaseModel for parsing style guide suggestions. Defaults to StyleGuideParserV2.

Returns:

chain: A chain for modifying input text based on style guide suggestions.

class chatbot_v2.ai.style_engine.StyleGuideParser(*, corrected_text: str, explanation: None | Dict[str, str | List[str]])[source]

Bases: BaseModel

Pydantic BaseModel for parsing style guide suggestions.

Attributes:

corrected_text (str): Suggested correction for the input text. explanation (Dict[str, Union[str, List[str]]]): Explanation for the correction under different context headers.

corrected_text: str
explanation: None | Dict[str, str | List[str]]
model_computed_fields: ClassVar[dict[str, ComputedFieldInfo]] = {}

A dictionary of computed field names and their corresponding ComputedFieldInfo objects.

model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

model_fields: ClassVar[dict[str, FieldInfo]] = {'corrected_text': FieldInfo(annotation=str, required=True, description='Suggest a simple modification/correction for the input, keep the corrected text precise as close as possible to the input. DO NOT make up additional text'), 'explanation': FieldInfo(annotation=Union[NoneType, Dict[str, Union[str, List[str]]]], required=True, description='In this field, several language style guide context headers will be provided, you will return a dictionary output as follows.\n                                              Keys: You most only list the provided context headers that were found applicable for editing and modifying the given input, DO NOT mention any header that was not found applicable for corrections.\n                                              Values: As values carefully explain under each context header that was found applicable, the different rules that was considered while making the corrections to provide the user with a rational explanation for your corrections.')}

Metadata about the fields defined on the model, mapping of field names to [FieldInfo][pydantic.fields.FieldInfo].

This replaces Model.__fields__ from Pydantic V1.

model_fields: ClassVar[dict[str, FieldInfo]] = {'corrected_text': FieldInfo(annotation=str, required=True, description='Suggest a simple modification/correction for the input, keep the corrected text precise as close as possible to the input. DO NOT make up additional text')}

Metadata about the fields defined on the model, mapping of field names to [FieldInfo][pydantic.fields.FieldInfo].

This replaces Model.__fields__ from Pydantic V1.
